p: The microstructures of 1.0C-1.5Cr steel after various processes were studied using EBSD, as shown in Figure 4. After spheroidization annealing, few low-angle grain boundaries (LAGBs, <10°) were observed ( Figure 4a,a1). However, there were a large number of LAGBs in the cold rolled 1.0C-1.5Cr steels, and the fraction of LAGBs was as high as ~80% ( Figure 4b,b1). Recrystallization annealing only eliminated part of LAGBs, with a fraction of 70% ( Figure 4c,c1). Interestingly, the fraction of LAGBs after cold drawing significantly increased to ~90% ( Figure 4d,d1). Besides, the image quality map clearly showed that a few undissolved carbides existed at the boundaries of ferrite, connected with LAGBs ( Figure 4b–d). The observed phenomenon must be related to the difference between boundary diffusion and volume diffusion of elements that might occur during cold deformation. This is discussed in Section 4.1.
